block.p: Nancy Elisabeth Furman and Marc Adam Paul, lawyers in Washington, are to be married today by Rabbi Julie Zupan at the Beach Point Club in Mamaroneck, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom, both 31, are associates at Washington law firms, she at Wilmer, Cutler & Pickering and he at Steptoe & Johnson.
Nancy Elisabeth Furman and Marc Adam Paul, lawyers in Washington, are to be married today by Rabbi Julie Zupan at the Beach Point Club in Mamaroneck, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom, both 31, are associates at Washington law firms, she at Wilmer, Cutler & Pickering and he at Steptoe & Johnson.

The bride graduated magna cum laude from Yale University and cum laude from Harvard Law School. Her parents, Joan and Frank Furman, live in White Plains, where the bride's mother is an educational consultant for high school students. The bride's father, now retired, was a vice president who developed computer systems for the private banking group at Citibank in New York.

The bridegroom graduated from Cornell University and received his law degree cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. His parents, Suzanne Z. Paul and Dr. Jay D. Paul, live in Wilmington, Del., where his mother retired as the director of education at Temple Beth Emeth and his father retired as an optometrist.
